title: paul's character design question of the week: Catlan ldot
content: so should the ldot character actually create additional space between the two l’s? or does the dot just nestle right inbetween the two l’s without creating any additional space?
author: paul d hunt

comments.content: Looks like it creates some additional space, Paul. I don’t care what anyone says, Vincent Connare knows what’s up and here’s a little something he says about it (notice the illustration and the UC configuration—either serious kerning or a composite glyph): [http://www.microsoft.com/typography/developers/fdsspec/diacritics.htm](http://web.archive.org/web/20051122170110/http:/www.microsoft.com/typography/developers/fdsspec/diacritics.htm)

More about Catalan ldot / Ldot can be found here:

[http://diacritics.typo.cz](http://web.archive.org/web/20051122170110/http:/diacritics.typo.cz/) (Dot Accent)

There is also a link to a PDF about Catalan ortography.
